title: ArcelorMittal to form JV with Nippon Steel to buy India's Essar Steel
text: March 2, 2018 / 6:51 AM / a few seconds ago ArcelorMittal to form JV with Nippon Steel to buy India's Essar Steel Reuters Staff 2 Min Read (Reuters) - The world’s largest steelmaker, ArcelorMittal SA ( MT.AS ), said on Friday its India unit would form a joint venture with Japan’s biggest steelmaker Nippon Steel & Sumitomo Metal Corp ( 5401.T ) to buy Indian steelmaker Essar Steel India Ltd, which is undergoing bankruptcy proceedings. FILE PHOTO - The logo of Essar group is seen at its headquarters in Mumbai, India August 21, 2017. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui ArcelorMittal unit ArcelorMittal India Pvt Ltd submitted a plan to India’s National Company Law Tribunal, which deals with insolvency and company disputes, on Feb. 12 to bid for Essar Steel in partnership with Nippon Steel. In February, ArcelorMittal and a group led by Russia’s VTB ( VTBR.MM ) made separate bids for Essar Steel, which faces claims of nearly $8 billion from banks and other creditors and suppliers. At the time, ArcelorMittal offered a“detailed industrial plan” for Essar Steel, aimed at improving its performance and profitability. Essar Steel was among a dozen of India’s biggest debt defaulters that were pushed to bankruptcy court last year after a central bank order aimed at clearing $147 billion in bad loans at the nation’s banks choked lending. Reporting by Abinaya Vijayaraghavan in Bengaluru; Editing by Amrutha Gayathri
